intro: Aragallus splendens, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Aragallus splendens is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
